text: After filtering for decent liquidity, whichever one you find most engaging

elements.text: After filtering for decent liquidity, whichever one you find most engaging

text: Footy always the most engaging, best sport in the world. Need data to build the models though, always been the issue. Glad to hear that pro is doable without horses though.

elements.text: Footy always the most engaging, best sport in the world. Need data to build the models though, always been the issue. Glad to hear that pro is doable without horses though.

text: Why would you only be able to make money on horses and no other sports?

elements.text: Why would you only be able to make money on horses and no other sports?

text: Ohh its not that you can't make money on other sports. I know others can and do make a living from non horse racing betting/trading. But I was trying to asses how hard that is by asking how many actually do it. Horse racing has the most opportunity I believe with a high event count and loads of liquid markets. Also I suspect it is one of the most irrational/softer markets. But I don't know where I stand on it ethically as a sport and am considering avoiding at least jumps races. Haven't made my mind up yet. Not looking to get into a debate about it or judging others who trade it, just my own stance.

text:
I'd leave ethics out of it if you want to make a success of things <@U03N4QBJ0TV> - particularly if profiting on betfair as we only profit by taking money from other players. Thinking about morality in the context of gambling could result in endless ethical wrangling if you let it.

That said, even though I am small time compared to most on here, my jumps/flat profits are about 20/80 percentage split so plenty to be made on flat only if jumps really leaves a sour taste in the mouth.

elements.text: I'd leave ethics out of it if you want to make a success of things

- particularly if profiting on betfair as we only profit by taking money from other players. Thinking about morality in the context of gambling could result in endless ethical wrangling if you let it.

That said, even though I am small time compared to most on here, my jumps/flat profits are about 20/80 percentage split so plenty to be made on flat only if jumps really leaves a sour taste in the mouth.

text: I have no ethical problem in beating other people who bet against me. I am taking on risk, if I screw up and they win then I have nothing against them. I am not limiting winners and only hearding mug punters into my 200% over round book.  My ethical problems with gambling lay in the fact that I think bookies should have been phased out long ago and everything should be exchanged based.  Thanks for the info on the 20/80 split DC.
